title: Inline attribute caused multiple function generated in final output
body:
I tried this code:

```rust
// in crate_a
#derive(Clone, Debug)
struct TestModel {
    ... // relative large to prevent the clone inlined
}

// in crate_b
#[inline(never)]
pub fn print_test_model(m: &crate_a::TestModel) {
    let mut m = m.clone();
    ... // some code to prevent m.clone() being optimized away. like rand modify field.
    println!("m: {:?}", m);
}

// in crate_c
#[inline(never)]
pub fn print_test_model(m: &crate_a::TestModel) {
    ... // similar code with crate_b's
}

```

I expected to see this happen: *the final dylib should contain only one TestModel::clone*

Instead, this happened: *I see two copies of TestModel::clone*

```
fn crate_a::{impl#0}::clone
	linkage name: _RNvXCsfUTv8AA3AYT_7crate_aNtB2_9TestModelNtNtCs7LZBGJj5Oc1_4core5clone5Clone5clone
	**address: 0xd673-0xe127**
	size: 2741
	return type:
		[552]	struct crate_a::TestModel
	parameters:
		[8]	self: &TestModel

fn crate_a::{impl#0}::clone
	linkage name: _RNvXCsfUTv8AA3AYT_7crate_aNtB2_9TestModelNtNtCs7LZBGJj5Oc1_4core5clone5Clone5clone
	**address: 0xc3ce-0xce82**
	size: 2741
	return type:
		[552]	struct crate_a::TestModel
	parameters:
		[8]	self: &TestModel
```

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.60.0-nightly (a00e130da 2022-01-29)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: a00e130dae74a213338e2b095ec855156d8f3d8a
commit-date: 2022-01-29
host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 1.60.0-nightly
LLVM version: 13.0.0
```
